cab.content: J. 7776/This Docnment is the Property ofHis wmaorno Majesty's GovemrnemUitary Secret.1009From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,22nd July 1919.9894. 22nd July. No. 72.Part I.-1. Later reports from Chitral state that raiding party on Bumboret, vide our telegram of the 20th instant, 9771, was composed of 600 Afghan regulars and 400 tribesmen. The collection of a Bajouri lashkar reported in same telegram is not confirmed.2. Situation in Bajour, Swat, Buner and Mohmand reported normal.3. Dispersal of Afridi lashkars and return of jirga to their homes is confirmed.4. No change in Waziristan.5. Political, Baluchistan, sends report of Afghan force from Rashid Kila moving into British territory towards Murgha Fakarzai, but aeroplane reconnaissance over that place saw no signs of enemy.6. Agent at Kabul 12th July reports that son of Saad ud Din (corrupt group) ICazi has been arrested in connection with attempt on Amir's life, reported in our telegram of the .19th instant, No. 69.Part II. 7. Cavalry patrol attacked on 20th July near Tsagai. No casualties. Para. 6 not communicated to Press.
